page.title: 19Village events.
page.content: A{Plough Sunday}Service is held in January either in Morton or Rolleston church. A dedication is made to the plough and to the work of the farmers. A social gathering follows.{Harvest {Festival}is celebrated in October in all churches. A wheatsheaf shaped loaf is baked from the newly gathered crop and displayed with other produce. A harvest supper follows at Morton and Rolleston.{Fiskerton and Morton Gala {Day}takes place in the summer at the sports field. There are races for children and an inter-village tug of war. A dance follows in the evening. A traditional procession of{Morris Men passes through Fiskerton each summer en route from Nottingham to Southwell. {The Three Tons Horticultural Show}has many classes of flowers, vegetables and home produce. Entries are sold afterwards to finance the next show.
